text.p: Autodesk Inc. said Tuesday it would acquire computer-aided-design software firm Softdesk Inc. in a deal valued at about $72 million, or $12 per share for Softdesk shareholders.
Autodesk, based in San Rafael, Calif., supplies PC design software, and Henniker, N.H.-based Softdesk supplies software for architecture, engineering and construction.

Autodesk said it would issue about 0.44 shares of its common stock for each outstanding Softdesk share, and that it expected to take a one-time charge of about $10 million to $12 million when the deal closed.
The merger was expected to close the first quarter of Autodesk's fiscal year, the companies said.
The deal was worth $72 million based on closing stock prices on Dec. 9, the companies said.
In connection with the deal, Softdesk said it also granted Autodesk an option to acquire 19.9 percent of Softdesk stock under certain circumstances.

Softdesk would be integrated into Autodesk's architecture, engineering and construction market group, would be headquartered in Henniker and managed by David Arnold, formerly Softdesk chief executive officer, the companies said.
